metadata.search_scope: Ultra deep web search for SNSF Narrative Digital Finance project outputs

project.title: Narrative Digital Finance: A Tale of Structural Breaks, Bubbles & Market Narratives

institutions.name: University of Twente
institutions.department: Faculty of Behavioural, Management and Social Sciences

research_description.background: Large fluctuations, instabilities, trends and uncertainty of financial markets constitute a substantial challenge for asset management companies, pension funds and regulators. Nowadays, most asset management companies and financial institutions follow a so-called systematic trading approach in their investment decisions. However, automated or rules-based trading activities bring certain risks for market participants and the whole financial market. In times of increased market volatility, market turmoil or so-called market sell-offs, investors applying similar trading rules might undertake the same actions, escalating and increasing systemic market risk.
research_description.rationale: Despite advancements in econometric methods, the detection of asset price bubbles and structural breaks remains uncertain and underexplored, particularly in the context of classic financial assets. Recent research underscores the powerful role of narratives in financial decision-making, suggesting that integrating textual analysis could enhance market understanding and prediction accuracy.
research_description.overall_objectives: Develop a comprehensive framework that utilizes advanced machine learning and NLP techniques to predict market outcomes, detect asset price bubbles, and identify structural breaks using diverse data sources, including financial data and narrative content from text, speech, and multimedia.
specific_aims: Validate and refine existing econometric models using real-world financial data
Integrate narrative analysis to understand and predict market behaviors and asset price dynamics
Create a multidimensional AI and ML framework that enhances the detection of market anomalies and forecasts financial trends
research_description.methods: The approach involves collecting and processing a wide range of data, including stock prices, macroeconomic indicators, and textual content from the web. We employ text mining and NLP techniques to analyze sentiment, narrative structures, and their impact on market movements. Developing and testing new AI models that combine traditional financial analysis with narrative insights to predict market changes and detect structural breaks.
expected_results: Enhanced models for predicting financial markets with greater accuracy, especially in detecting asset price bubbles and structural breaks
Novel datasets and measurement techniques that provide deeper insights into the interplay between market narratives and financial indicators
Practical tools for asset management and regulatory bodies to better anticipate and react to market crises
research_description.impact: This research aims to bridge the gap between traditional econometric approaches and modern AI techniques, providing new insights into the role of narratives and quantitative data in financial decision-making. The results offer valuable tools for risk management, asset pricing, and optimizing trading strategies, potentially influencing policy and regulatory practices globally.

directly_related.title: A Primer on Narrative Finance
directly_related.abstract: Narrative Finance is a relatively new field that aims to understand the narratives that shape financial markets and how these narratives influence market outcomes. This primer covers the use of Narrative Finance in sustainable finance, AI applications, study of different narratives that shape perceptions of different types of assets and investments, emerging markets, and how financial narratives are communicated through different media channels.

directly_related.title: Hypothesizing Multimodal Influence: Assessing the Impact of Textual and Non-Textual Data on Financial Instrument Pricing Using NLP and Generative AI
directly_related.abstract: This paper presents an advanced conceptual framework for the analysis of textual data in the context of financial securities, hypothesizing that a comprehensive evaluation of events within the broader economic environment, particularly through their descriptions, significantly influences the pricing of financial instruments. Extends beyond traditional NLP by proposing inclusion of non-textual data forms such as images, videos, and audio.

directly_related.title: Leveraging Network Topology for Credit Risk Assessment in P2P Lending: A Comparative Study under the Lens of Machine Learning
directly_related.abstract: This study uses Machine Learning (ML) and network analysis for P2P credit default prediction. Developed graph-based models for loan risk assessment and found that model prediction accuracy improved under the use of network centrality features.

directly_related.title: Network Centrality and Credit Risk: A Comprehensive Analysis of Peer-to-Peer Lending Dynamics
directly_related.abstract: Analyzes credit risk assessment in P2P lending using dataset from Bondora. Combines traditional credit features with network topological features (degree centrality) to showcase the crucial role of a borrower's position and connectivity within the P2P network in determining loan default probabilities.

directly_related.title: Reaction Times to Economic News in High-Frequency Trading: An Analysis of Latency and Informed Trading reacting to Macro-News Announcements
directly_related.abstract: Joint research with Deutsche Borse on high-frequency trading and market microstructure.
